title: Masala Dosa
instructions: Soak rice, urad dal, chana dal, toor dal, poha, and fenugreek seeds together for 4-6 hours.
Grind to a smooth batter and ferment overnight.
Boil potatoes, mash them, and keep aside.
Heat oil, add mustard seeds, and let them splutter.
Add onions, green chilies, and turmeric powder, and sauté until onions are translucent.
Add mashed potatoes and salt, mix well, and cook for 5 minutes.
Heat a dosa pan, pour a ladle of batter, and spread it in a circular motion.
Drizzle oil around the edges and cook until crisp.
Place the potato filling in the center and fold the dosa.
Serve hot with chutney and sambar.

title: Idli
instructions: Soak rice, urad dal, and poha for 4-6 hours.
Grind to a smooth batter and ferment overnight.
Add salt and mix well.
Grease idli molds and pour the batter into them.
Steam for 10-12 minutes or until idlis are cooked.
Serve hot with chutney and sambar.

title: Pongal
instructions: Dry roast moong dal until aromatic.
In a pot, add rice, moong dal, turmeric powder, and salt with enough water to cook.
Pressure cook until soft and mushy.
In a separate pan, heat ghee, add cumin seeds, black pepper, asafoetida, and curry leaves.
Pour the tempering over the cooked rice and dal mixture.
Garnish with roasted cashews.
Serve hot with coconut chutney.

title: Payasam
instructions: Heat ghee in a pan, add vermicelli and roast until golden brown.
Add milk and bring it to a boil.
Simmer until the vermicelli is cooked.
Add sugar and cardamom powder, and cook for another 5 minutes.
In a separate pan, fry cashews and raisins in ghee until golden.
Garnish the payasam with fried cashews and raisins.
Serve warm or chilled.

title: Lasagna
instructions: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
Cook the lasagna noodles according to the package instructions.
In a pan, cook the ground beef until browned.
Add the onion and garlic, and cook until softened.
Stir in the tomato sauce and simmer for 15 minutes.
In a bowl, mix the ricotta cheese with the egg, salt, and pepper.
In a baking dish, layer the noodles, meat sauce, ricotta mixture, and mozzarella.
Repeat the layers, finishing with mozzarella and Parmesan.
Bake for 25-30 minutes until the cheese is golden and bubbly.
Let it cool slightly before serving.

title: Carbonara
instructions: Cook the spaghetti according to the package instructions.
In a pan, cook the pancetta until crispy.
Add the garlic and sauté for a minute.
In a bowl, whisk the eggs with the grated Parmesan.
Drain the pasta and add it to the pan with the pancetta.
Remove from heat, then quickly stir in the egg mixture.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve immediately.

title: Tiramisu
instructions: Prepare the coffee and let it cool.
Separate the eggs, beating the yolks with sugar until creamy.
Add the mascarpone to the yolk mixture and mix until smooth.
In another bowl, beat the egg whites until stiff peaks form.
Gently fold the egg whites into the mascarpone mixture.
Dip the ladyfingers into the coffee and arrange them in a dish.
Spread half of the mascarpone mixture over the ladyfingers.
Add another layer of dipped ladyfingers and top with the remaining mascarpone.
Chill in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours.
Dust with cocoa powder before serving.

title: Grilled Beef Steak
instructions: Preheat your grill to high heat.
Brush the steaks with olive oil on both sides.
Rub the garlic, salt, pepper, rosemary, and thyme into the steaks.
Place the steaks on the grill and cook for 3-4 minutes on each side for medium-rare, or longer to your desired doneness.
Remove the steaks from the grill and let them rest for 5 minutes before serving.

title: BBQ Ribs
instructions: Preheat your oven to 300°F (150°C).
Mix together the brown sugar, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, black pepper, and cayenne pepper to create a dry rub.
Rub the mixture all over the ribs, covering both sides.
Wrap the ribs in aluminum foil and place them on a baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven for 2.5 to 3 hours, or until the meat is tender.
Remove the ribs from the oven and discard the foil.
Brush the ribs with BBQ sauce.
Preheat your grill to medium-high heat.
Grill the ribs for about 5 minutes on each side, basting with more BBQ sauce as you go, until the sauce is caramelized.
Serve hot.

title: Apple Pie
instructions: Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
In a large bowl, mix the apples, sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, flour, and lemon juice.
Place one pie crust in a pie dish and fill with the apple mixture.
Cover with the second pie crust, crimp the edges, and cut slits for ventilation.
Bake for 45-50 minutes until the crust is golden brown.
Let cool before serving.
